title: Clean Energy Tax Break Draws Scrutiny of Natural Gas Plan in New Mexico
description: A defunct New Mexico coal plant would be revamped with the help of subsidies authorized by the new climate legislation, but a plan to rely on natural gas converted into hydrogen has generated criticism.
dc:creator: Eric Lipton

media:content.media:credit: Adria Malcolm for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A defunct coal-burning power plant in northwest New Mexico may be turned into one that derives hydrogen from natural gas for use in generating electricity.
